caption: Went here for Restaurant Week. Wow, so much food! Just one person eating the Restaurant Week menu will have leftovers so I’d suggest ordering one fixed price menu and then a la carte if there’s other things you want to try. You’ll have plenty leftover. The pork dumplings are amazing. The “My Friend Gen” drink was refreshing! Got a massive portion of JJ noodles! The KFC was good, but not the best in the city. The Fire chicken was underwhelming, tasted more smoky than flavorful. Our LA galbi was a little burnt, the pork belly was O-K... we ordered the ssam kit and it only had 2 perilla leaves, rest was lettuce. It was a fun experience and service was good. Excellent way to try new things.  I’ll probably come back to try more dishes!

I’ve been here twice in the course of two years, and Perilla never disappoints! The food is delicious! However, I would say if you are going to attend during Restaurant week, the service is a bit slower, assuming that they were crazy busy! Our table of four took 2.5hrs total to have all the courses served. 5 stars though since the food was amazing and the waiter and bartender were very kind. Will definitely be returning.
It's not just the delectable food. That's a given.  The service is bar none.  Whether you're a rookie or a K-food expert, you will find and love every dish.
Excellent place to bring your friends for a treat!
Delicious food and great for sharing.

ABSOLUTE MUST TRY!! Perilla really hits every tastebud and their drinks are unreal. We ordered the JJ Noodles, Silken Tofu Stew, Non Marinated Short Rib, Ssam set and traditional chicken wings to go. It did not disappoint coming from your neighborhood half korean. You will not regret eating or drinking here. 너무너무 맛있었엉~~
spectacular food (chicken wings is a must try) - a warm patio - friendly staff!
Excellent! Hot stone bebimbap was excellent and the new heaters were so warm!
Great food and better services.
Great heated patio, very friendly staff, and the food is delicious.

They served a mouth-watering Korean dishes. Especially, their sampgyeopsal and Army-stew are a must-try. The ambiance of the place will give you a glimpse of Korea's famous city. The setup and the decoration were so cute.  The staves were so friendly and accommodating.

We so enjoyed our dinner of bulgogi and spicy pork dumplings!  We picked up (side window is very covid friendly) and packaging was great to keep food warm.  Well worth a trip.  We will be coming back.
Low quality tourist trap.
My favorite spot for tasty korean food. Certainly worth a return visit. Prices were fair for the quality of the food. Atmosphere is similar to a place in Columbus I loved.
Servers are hella rude but the food is bomb af.  If you have time and don't mind waiting then definitely try out their chicken.  It's so worth it!

Reservations highly recommended and lots of outdoor seating with heaters (could use either a few more or better placement). When you arrive, you are assigned a table and they have a QR menu. When you are ready to order, you go up to the window and they give you a buzzer for when the food is ready.  Overall the food was delicious though some bits were a bit too Americanized (like the bulgogi). However, definitely would come back! The beef dish melted in the mouth and the chicken wings are great.  Biggest draw back was the heater issue mentioned above (was a tad chilly) and maybe some more sanitation stations.
Love the patio.
Korean food and the feeling here is quality. i love this place always quality food & service. i will be back with my friends.
korean food and the atmosphere here is excellent. I like it here, excellent food & service.
Food was good. Their patio area was awesome. Sadly it was hard to enjoy their food since the food came out at once, and they got cold quick.
Korean food at this location - yummy. The service was very helpful and welcoming.
Fine place for tasty korean food. Great place to meet and catch up with friends. The staff was helpful and kind. Bring your hunger - portions are generous.
korean food, super satisfying. staff is always timely even when they have a full house. i see why this place has so many good reviews.
Really great outdoor space. Tried a variety of dishes and everything was good. They are very strict with seating and masks which was helpful.
Excellent fried rice, add the spicy pork to make it even better
Friendly service, healthy portions, and authentic Korean flavors with some modern twists.  Perfect spot for any occasion.

Dined on their patio last night with some friends in from out of town and had an amazing time! The Kimchi Fries are insanely tasty and the "An Old Friend" cocktail paired perfectly with the spacious and well designed outdoor setup. They were on top of their covid/ppe game and we felt comfortable and safe! Oh, and have you seen their Michelle Obama mural?? I'll be back, probably this week!
Everything was so good!
Wonderful and accommodating staff during quarentine, delicious food (love those side dishes!) And helpful customer service!
Great KBBQ and great service! If you're ever in Chicago, give this place a shot!

We arrived at this spot for lunch. we heard about this spot from quite a few people.  Well, it was a winning. we were warmly welcomed by the staff members  and we had a great feeling. The food was just great. We had a great time and we will visit this place again. we highly recommend this place.
Best Korean BBQ in Chicago
Absolutely a place worth stopping by, the food is fantastic and well prepared, the prices are reasonable and it is constantly well organized there. Keep up the good work.

This place is my favorite site.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this place. Whenever  I I need a proper lunchon, this is the place that comes instantly to my mind. splendid and   food and a rich menu.helpful team, and pleasant spirit. Not less important, the cost is reasonable. I sent my friends to this restaurant with no doubt.
Amazing. Great food great drinks. Owner made sure he stopped at our table multiple times to check and cook the food.
I regularly come by getting some food in this spot. I like the fast service and well cooked food. Keep up the good work.
Pretty authentic.
Delicious! Amazing! Innovative. I'm used to more authentic cheap Korean bbq but this was amazing fusion. It was quite pricey but worth the experience.
Great food. Nice experience. Friendly staff. I would certainly recommend this spot.
Been a few times now. This visit had no bbq items and focused on dishes including the wings and tteokebokki which were both excellent. Service and drinks are up to the standard of the food as well.
This place never fails to impress. They have fantastic food for affordable pricing, there no long wait even when they are loaded.
Excellent Korean BBQ.  Definitely will be back.
The name changed but the food remained incredible. Definitely come with a group
Best place to eat a Korean food, that bulgogi is delicious!!
This had a different name the last time I went but it was completely delish.  I hope it is still the same food quality with the change of name.  Servers were also quite nice.

I’ve been here on multiple occasions and i can not express enough how much I love this restaurant. I am Korean and I consider myself a Chicago foodie. What I love the most about Perilla is that they have both traits that make a restaurant great, food and service. Top notch hospitality from the moment I walk in and I’m greeted by the hostess to the end when I’m given my check from the manager and personally wished a happy birthday. I’m pretty sure I have been to all the Korean bbq spots in chicago and I think Perilla has the best meat quality and food preparations. I really cant name a dish that I haven’t liked since I’ve been there multiple time. (Yes, I have tried the whole menu) I got to meet Chef Andy and the managers Thomas and Yura, great people who know how to get the job done. As in give the paying guest a great experience! If you haven’t been here you’re missing out!

This place is my favorite. I eat in many restaurants but to this restaurant I  constantly return again and again. The crew is very affectionate and the cuisine they offer is so flavorful. I am always happy to have a good dinner in this place. I highly recommend this place.
Excellent Korean BBQ, house made ban chan, and soju cocktails. Friendly staff and great service. Easy enough to find street parking in the area.
Exceptional place to have some food when in a rush. The service is quick, rates are reasonable, good mood. Highly recommended
Pretty authentic Korean BBQ. Bulgolgi pork belly and be bim bop. We ordered LOTS OF food and was shocked how reasonable the end bill was. Friendly staff, highly recommended.
Excellent food, wonderful service but very noisy. Parking can be an issue. We'll go again.

Perilla was a lot better than expected. Food quality was really good and all the sides were amazing. Our favorite was the fried potatoes appetizer and the ribeye. The service was excellent and we were able to check out the patio which was a cool outdoor space to hangout when the weather is nice.
Amazing place. Food, ambiance, cocktails, service... It has it all.
Nice atmosphere. Attentive service.
Terrible service
Delicious korean food, excellent service. definitely recommend!
Awesome food, very welcoming staff members, regularly  awesome character. They charge fair prices and the food quality is awesome. I recommend this place.

two days ago was our first time in this restaurant. But It is obviously not the last time. We passed a splendid evening with the good service, with the finest cooking and booze and with the friendly price. We will definitely return there again.

This is not another Korean fusion or a below average KBBQ restaurant. It's simply just great Korean food.  I brought my family (all Korean) here and we all felt right at home. I appreciated how accommodating the staff was with two hungry kids as well.  Although we were all already familiar with the smaller dishes (banchan) typically served at Korean restaurants, I was very impressed with how our server explained exactly what each small dish was. I've never experienced that before in a Korean restaurant and I felt that was a nice touch.  Appetizers: The seafood pancake was delicious. The pork dumplings were cooked perfectly - crispy and golden on the outside and juicy hot on the inside. The sauteed brussels sprouts was a great balance to the main meat courses ordered below.  Main dishes: The marinated prime short rib was flavorful and satisfying. The non-marinated prime rib eye was my favorite. The soybean stew was just like how my mom would make it.  I typically drink non-flavored soju with Korean food but our server recommended pairing our meal with the Plum flavor and I've never looked back. Order that.  Thanks for such a pleasant experience. Let's just say, I'll be back.

Arguably the best korean dishes in chicago. The marriage between the traditional flavors and modern technique and preparations are both unique and nostalgic. The service and attention to detail made the experience very comfortable and easy to enjoy. I would highly recommend the bbq (la bbq) and the plethora or amazing apps (ie sardines and brussel sprouts). Cocktails were definitely a hit (I would rec an old friend or silk roads). This restaurant is a must- put it on your list people!
Amazing food! Amazing staff. Can’t miss dinner location.
good food, enough to fill you but not to make you full. solid spot

Friendly host and servers. Magnificent mural of Michelle Obama in a hanbok on the outside wall!! But pricey for Korean food. I only had the fried chicken, and it was good, but not worth $15 (7 pieces). Verdict: SAVE YOUR $ and eat Korean food elsewhere.

The cocktails are like asian twists of classics, which is really awesome and something I've never seen before. I didn't really like their wings (the sauces in particular), but everything else was great, especially the bulgogi and japchae. The staff and bartender were super friendly and made great conversation while we waited at the bar. There's a back seating area by the bar that's pretty cute, but there weren't any grills there so I'm not sure if they seat people there normally. There also isn't a lot of seating, but it's worth waiting for!
Exceptional food, exceptional service! The BBQ side and small plate side of the restaurant are both phenomenal. Happy hour is also a great deal!
This spot provides wonderful service and delightful food. One of the best spot in town. The food arrived quick and the rates were affordable. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.
Super expensive, food was alright
I certainly love their dishes and customer service, fantastic location nearby to where I live. The employees are always very friendly. I highly recommend this place.
The meat quality is not that good. The banchan too. But young people  like it.maybe atmosphere...
Tasty. Surprisingly authentic. Sizeable portions.
Dinner with work colleagues. Beef was pretty good. Service was a little patchy - had to remind the wait staff for the routine side dishes

Good service and food.  Definately a bit on the pricey end for korean bbq.  Usually when you order a la carte it is 2 servings, but here it is for 1 serving.  (We didnt order a la carte but it said it is for 1 person on the menu)  There is a "feast for 2" and "feast for 4" that is a better deal.  There is a chance you can get seated at the same table with a different party already there.  Not a big deal, but would have preferred sitting at our own table.  They also ran out of perilla (sesame) leaves.  We only got 1 for the table and the lettuce they had was way too small to properly make a lettuce wrap with the meat.  The best part of the meal for me was the roasted asparagus. Food is good but imho not worth the price.  There are kbbq places just as good but much cheaper.  Although the price could reflect the location of the restaurant.  Giving it 4 stars just because the only complaint I have is the price. (And running out of perilla leaves).
Good quality food but definitely lacking flavor compared to traditional Korean food.   I appreciate that they don't go over board on salt, but the umami was still lacking.
Great food and great staff. Fun atmosphere.
Good variety and flavors very modern Korean-American food. Staff is nice and helpful. It can get pretty noisy on a weekend.

Great food! Great staff! I wasn't expecting much since I'm Korean and I've been to many different Korean restaurants so I thought it was going to be a typical Korean restaurant.  I was wrong.  Our server was so friendly.  One of the owner came by to talk to us and asked us how we liked our food.  This almost never happens in a Korean restaurant, unless you're in a small mom and pop type of restaurant. One of our friend was vegan and I was a bit worried that she might not find anything to eat but she found many options and she loved it.  It was her 1st time trying Korean food.  Kimchee was authentic and so delicious.  Best of all, our beef was so good!  I also liked the the seating arrangements. We were seated on a long table, like a long picnic table.  We would definitely come back again soon.
Food was good one of the servers had a terrible attitude

For those confused - Perilla took over the location of San Doo K BBQ. Plus, it services similar food...so it’s confusing. But it IS a new place under new management.  Food ordered: 1. Marinated Prime Ribeye: literally melts in your mouth. The meat is super tender and the marinade is light and not overbearing so you can enjoy the taste of the meat. It’s also served with a lettuce basket and dipping sauce so you can make ssam and enjoy it authentic korean bbq style. 2. Kimchi Stew 3. Sauteed Brussels Sprouts: SO GOOD. It’s definitely a must try. It’s a completely new flavor and texture profile from any “Asian fusion” restaurants. They add crispy garlic - yum! It’s savory, light, nutty (almost) - you just have to try it. 4. Cheese Corn: has cojita cheese in it and reminds me of a light elote. 5. Steamed egg (I didn’t order but shout out to the manager for giving us on the house!): THIS IS THE HIDDEN GEM. it’s not like a traditional steamed egg served in most korean restaurants. Check out my photo and video of it. You must try!!  The food and service were on point! There’s also a korean beer list which is a fun pairing with the food. The portion sizes are generous (I definitely over ordered) but so well worth it. It’s a good dining experience for both “seasoned” korean bbq-ers and newbies.  The manager and owner both dropped by frequently to check in on us and made us feel so well taken care of.

If you want something new, something with flavor & great staff then this should be your go to place in Chicago, with foods that you’d think you’d never eat but cannot stop consuming after your trip here. With a patio in the back for you to enjoy your breezy days or hot summer ones, a fire place to warm up at night, & not to mention the amazing portrait of Michelle Obama in the back. Curious? Come in when you got a chance.

Dove headfirst into the Large Feast with two friends.  We had the scallion pancake, sautéed brusselsprouts, pork dumplings, soy marinated mushrooms, Korean fried chicken, and the unmarinated short rib and pork belly.  The banchan were delightful and the house ssamjang was great.
Delicious, thoughtfully prepared traditional Korean food with a modern twist.  Creative and delicious handcrafted cocktails. Great outdoor lounge with a beautiful Michelle Obama mural. A must visit!
Delicious and unique food with a matching atmosphere. I highly recommend and cannot wait to go back!
Don't skip on: the Corn, Brussel sprouts, glass noodles, asparagus, oh wait, everything was delicious and you should go soon.
The service and atmosphere is nice, but if you are searching for tasty authentic korean food this is not the place to go!
Outstanding food and delicious! Excited to have a great Korean restaurant in the neighborhood
Best modern Korean-American restaurant in Chicagoland!!

Food is totally different taste of Korean. Too salty! And most above all, service was awful. Foods came out so lately and server(?) didn't know how to cook meats so we did by ourselves.  Food was not so good so even i didn't take pictures!
A bit pricey but very good

Great atmosphere and vibes, creative foods that are traditional for the most part, yet the smallest American twist. Very tastefully made, plus the new Michelle Obama mural on the side of the restaurant is stunning! :)
Wow.  That is all I have to say.  The restaurant is amazing the staff is ultra and the food is EPIC.  Must stop must try much greatness
(Translated by Google) Awuesome ♡♡♡  (Original) Awuesome♡♡♡

Perilla is awesome. Their take on Korean American food is delicious.  We did KBBQ with the a la carte meats. The meats were great quality. We also got the brussel sprouts. It has to be one of the best brussel sprout dishes I've ever had. Their side dishes were also good. We got at least 3 refills of them all.  Please note that this place used to be San Soo KBBQ. There are still many reviews prior to July 2019 for San Soo.
We had the Brussels sprouts, mandu, bulgogi, and kalbi - it was all excellent.  Perilla is vying for our top pick for Korean BBQ in Chicago.
The most Americanized Korean BBQ I've ever had. Banchan severely lacking. No garlic. Looked at me funny when I asked for doenjang jigae.
Highly recommend this place!!!! Good vibe and super good food 🤙🏻🤙🏻
The food of this restaurant is similar to that of Korea.

username: Mad Science of Chicago's Western Suburbs

caption: (Translated by Google) This restaurant is amazing. Nice staff. Delicious food. I tried to go to Chosun-ok and eat bibim noodle but it was not until the 9th of the afternoon. It is really delicious. Although I do not have cold noodles, other foods are really delicious. Japchae. I'm. meat. Bibimbap is good and the price is good. The staff is really friendly !! I want to come again. I am hesitant because I have a bad rating at first, but it is really good!  (Original) This restaurant is amazing. Nice staff. Delicious food. 원래 조선옥을 가서 비빔 냉면을 먹으려 했는데 멀고 9시반까지뿐 안해서 가게 되었는데 정말 엄청 맛있습니다.. 비록 냉면은 안하지만 다른 음식들이 정말 맛있고요. 잡채. 전. 고기. 비빔밥 덩말 훌륭하고 가격도 좋습니다. 직원들이 정말 친절합니다!! 또 오고 싶습니다. 처음에 평점이 안좋은 분 있어서 망설이다 간곳인데 정말 강추입니다!

(Translated by Google) I made marbled, kimchi, and egg steamed ... Kimchi was a little panicked because it was not the taste I usually eat at a Korean restaurant. And when I ate a barbecue, I ate vegetables (salads?) That came with me, and then I added $ 4 to the bill. Usually, Korean restaurants do not charge extra for me to order more dishes. Anyway, the food is Korean food, but I feel it is not Korean restaurant.  (Original) 차돌박이와 김치전, 그리고 계란찜을 시켰는데...김치전은 보통 한국식당에서 먹던 맛이 아니라서 살짝 당황했어요. 그리고 바베큐를 먹을때 같이 나오는 야채(샐러드?)를 더 달라고 해서 먹었는데 나중에 계산서에 $4이 추가되었더라구요. 보통 한국식당에선 반찬 더 달라고해서 추가요금이 발생하진 않죠. 암튼 음식은 한국음식인데 한국식당이 아니라는 느낌이 많이 들었습니다.

I had a dinner at San Soo on 6/22 and am quite disappointed. We ordered feast menu.  1) Some dumplings are cold inside.  2) Server didn't control fire well in the beginning and burnt some meat. They were too busy to serve several tables.  3) We ordered soybean stew but we didn't get until we finished all other food. We asked several times but the server said it would come out soon. And, it is funny, instead they brought kimchi stew, at the end. We rejected and they apologized. Even they said they will handle this. But, still final bill didn't deduct the soybean stew. We paid all.  This is my first review for a restaurant in Yelp. I visited this restaurant because of its good review, so decided to spend time to write this review to help others make good choice in future. Please avoid this restaurant.
Food is top notch...service is amazing...I’ve gone back to back to back days to eat...my favorite Korean BBQ place by a mile!
Excellent, tasty food. Good portions, spicy like we like it. Good service, and atmosphere.

Absolutely horrible service. Waited 15 minutes and a waiter never showed up to attend us. Different waiters came to say someone will attend us shortly but no one ever came. The restuarant was not even busy either.
Amazing food!! Highly recommend the shared feast! Was impressed and will be back
Hi, I’d like to commend Thomas and the service team.  I ordered an item on Grubhub that did not list that it included pork. I called San soo, they refunded it and were very kind.
Food is OK. But the phone number on google is not reachable. Also they don’t value online orders
Ahhh mazing

AMAZING MEATS AND AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE. Super friendly and welcoming staff. Loved how they are very attentive here too. As soon as you’re done they are ready to serve your next dish!! 10/10 highly recommend especially as a first time visitor to Chicago!! Great dining experience overall.
HORRIBLE SERVICE
There is a Korean restaurant and free side dishes.
Good food but expensive.  Can find similar for less
Very friendly and a huge tasty side dishes
A fav spot for delicious Korean food. I love snacking here. Looking forward to coming back with my friends. Bring your hunger - portions are large.
Good Korean BBQ at a reasonable price for the area

I can't speak to the quality of their food, but this business has awful service and organization. I ordered food from them on Grubhub. 1.5 hours later they called me and said my "food had been stolen" and that it I "would not be getting my food". True to their word, I never received my food, nor did they offer to make up for it. Based on this experience, don't waste your time and money here.
Very enjoyable!
Interesting menu, service was forgetful.

Being familiar with korean culture and food. I have never ever had a complaint about any korean restaurant. Being from NYC and having lived and worked in Seoul. It has always  been an incredible experience. Travel to Chicago for work and was craving to try a korean restaurant here. Googled it. Looked good. Walked in the door. No acknowledgment. Escorted to a table. No acknowledgment from the korean waiters. A few minutes later the non Korean host approached me to see if I was ready to order. I asked for a soju. He had no idea what it was   Since he said “ I don’t drink so I don’t know what it is. “ He came back with a story that they ran out of soju. Had never heard this before in my lifetime. At this point I was ready to bail out. Decided to stay and order a traditional hot pot binbibop. Which I kid you not. It come out 3 minutes after I ordered it. Was it just sitting there. The small dishes arrived later. Usually if ordered in a hot pot. It would be extremely hot. Can’t even touch it. This one warm. I have to admit. The only non korean waiter was extremely attentive after he noticed my discomfort. Also not crowded with plenty open tables. So that’s not an excuse. I’m not a complainer and this is my first negative review of a korean restaurant. Will never suggest this place. Thank god I live in nyc and travel often to Seoul.

It was delicious. Everything was great. Such a great place for a group and very accomadating. Service was superb and the food was amazing. Went with a group of 7 and ordered so many great dishes. I will definately recommend and i will be back!
Staff was short with customers, food was ok but better Korean exists in the city.
Nice and tasty Korean food
My food and overall experience was amazing  nicest Korean bbq spot in Chicago. There banchan was the bomb
Unbelievable service and food
Awesome vibe - great cocktail menu as well. Food and atmosphere was amazing. Looking for a low key place and friendly staff this is the place to come.

I went there with my husband, my brother and my mom. We ordered the $120 set menu for 4. I appreciated that we could customize it! Everything we had today was very flavorful. Personally I thought the brussels and the soup were a bit too salty. The Bulgogi was a little soggy somehow. Everything else was OK. I’m not sure, maybe because I live very close to Glenview where there are a lot of great Korean restaurants, I wasn’t amazed by the food. I liked the modern touch but I felt like it was too leaning toward traditional style. Usually when I go to a traditional Korean restaurant there are always a lot of Koreans eating there. I was very pleasantly surprised by the the diversity of crowd. Catering to the young people downtown I think the food could be more adventurous! Anyway, I would have given a 4.5 stars if there’s an option. The amount of food we got for $120 was pretty impressive. We couldn’t finish and had to take some home. The service was great and staff very friendly!
Best kbbq I've had in Chicago. I would definitely check out the kimchi pancakes. The ones here blew all the other kimchi pancakes I've ever had out of the water.
The food is good.  I'd like more detail on the sides and condiments though.  Get the bulgogi.

I'll give this a 4 star just because, but honestly, it could have been 5 if it wasn't for a few things. The menu is really limited, I was hoping for a larger variety, like the other locations. This one has a very limited Korean BBQ menu, as well as sub-par side dishes that come along with the KBBQ. The service was definitely impeccable and spot on. One of the things contributing to the lack of a complete 5 star review was the Kimchi Fried Rice. The rice was definitely way too soggy. My friend and I left it to sit in the stone bowl for a bit longer and it still didn't get crispy enough. I don't recommend their Fire Chicken. It's just cubed dark meat chicken tossed in hot sauce with some cheese. The grill gets burnt way too fast and there's no vents above you to intake the smoke. There are vents around the ceiling, but very sparingly placed.

The staff was very welcoming and efficient. The food was delicious. We ordered different plates and definitely had enough. The food was delicious! It has a nice aesthetic. They mostly played kpop songs in the background.
Interesting experience in cooking your food. Will definitely come back.
Delicious. Great for date night!

We came here for dinner on Valentine's day with an advance reservation. Very chic decor! They had a special Valentine's day menu ($75 for 2) but we ordered from the regular menu and it was great! Good variety of kimchi bites and meat. The seafood pancake was made to perfection! We also enjoyed the hot bulgogi stone bowl though it could have been spicier. Something that really made the difference for me is that they cook the meat for you on the grill right there in front of you (as opposed to us having to grill it ourselves). We had the pork belly done this way and it was amazing! Kudos to the fast service and our server Norrell! By the time we were done with our dishes and the myriad sides, we were full to the rim! Definitely one of my most enjoyable BBQ experiences!

The restaurant has a really nice vibe and it was extremely quiet when I went. Our server was really really friendly and recommended some good stuff for us. As usual all the side dishes are provided and (all the ones I ate) tasted great! We also gobbled up the Kimchi Pancake pretty quickly after it was served. The actual BBQ meats themselves we're pretty good too. Good place to hang and just eat with friends :)
Really good food and service. Try the chicken wings! Yum!
First time at Korean BBQ. Amazing experience! Joe was a great server. He made the experience quick and effortless.
Good intro place for Korean BBQ, the staff are knowledgeable and friendly, the banchan tasty and varied, with a decent selection of other dishes.

Really bad food and service. Long story if you want to hear about it.  We were told that if we ordered the non bbq dish we'll get seated right away. A guy escorted us to the bar area in the back as if there were seats available. When we got there he didn't see any availability so he said sorry we don't have seats. You guys can just stand by the bar and order drinks first. After explaining to us, he turned around and said oh look a seat opened up. He just gave us the menu and we were left to head towards where he pointed to the available area which had NO seats just bar tables. We had to take a chair from the people sitting next to us and it was only one chair. But we were left to organize our "eating" area. We took the paper towels and utensils from nearby tables and had to steal another chair from another table for our two top. Truly self service or bad service???  We ordered kimchi stew and bean paste stew. Kimchi stew was like literally someone dumping kimchi in and diluted it with water. What about seasoning?? Can you source better kimchi for the soup? Bean paste stew was the WORST. It was so salty that it was inedible. I had to dilute the stew with my drinking water. Even so it was still so salty that I just gave up and scooped out the veggies to eat. Someone didn't measure their miso paste right! It doesn't have to be authentic it just has to taste good. Which this place fails horribly. Husband said at least kimchi stew still tasted better than H-mart which meant it was edible but it's not Cho Sun Ok level if you know what I mean.  On top of that I informed the waitress that the soup was salty because she asked how everything was. She kindly apologized and said she'll inform the chef (it was her first day at the restaurant so I was being pretty calm about expressing how salty it was). She later came back and told me that the manager is waiting for me at the bar if I would like to speak with him. Wow! Not blaiming the new waitress because she was pleasant but shouldn't the manager come to me to apologize for the salty soup???? It sounded like I was called in for a trouble that I had caused. At this point I was extremely peeved. I asked for the check, paid for everything, and tipped like normal. Did not stop at the bar to talk to the manager because they don't deserve to hear my feedback at the restaurant if they don't make the effort to drop by to talk about their horrible food.

(Translated by Google) It is Korean restaurant, but it is different from the general Korean restaurant. ㅎ The staffs were friendly and the meat was delicious, too.  (Original) 한국식당인데 일반적인 한국식당하고 분위기가 달라요ㅎㅎ 직원들도 친절하고 고기도 맛있었는데 계란찜에서 좀 탄맛이 나서 아쉬웠어요~
Best kbbq I've ever had. Can't recommend this place enough.
Really great Korean BBQ restaurants in a cool setting.
Service was awesome. Food was amazing. Had an amazing time with my friends.  Definitely check it out!

Food was amazing and service was very helpful and fast! We ordered the kimchi pancake, hot stone bowl with bulgogi, and marinated short ribs. All three were delicious and more than enough food for two people. Can't wait to come back and try out more of the menu!

I had a great time at Sansoo yesterday. I had heard from friends they had a rough start, but after changing some things internally and getting a new chef, I think they’ve turned it into a great local Korean destination. I love this because most other Korean spots are far up north and it’s a hassle to get up there. Their grilled pork dish, egg appetizer dish and kimchi soup are solid. The Ribeye in my opinion was the standout item and of very high quality. Not to mention the service was excellent. I’ll be back soon!
Everything was great!!
Great food and service with a modern atmosphere.
Food was good. Just a little surprised that I got an up charged for "rocks" with my whiskey....

This upscale iteration on San Soo Gab San delivers on delicious Korean BBQ, drinks, and great service. There was a slight mixup with our reservation for our group of 10 on a busy weekend night, but the GM quickly adapted, seated us, and comped an appetizer. The food was all top notch and I look forward to returning.
Great experience get a group and go. Good for adventurous dates too.

Just don't go, there's other places that'll cost less and you'll actually enjoy the food. Go eat at a Korean BBQ buffet your experience will be better. My main complaint is price. If you don't believe me go there and you'll know exactly what I'm talking about.
Portions are small as hell. Paid way to much. I don't recommend it, you'll definitely be disappointed and that's a promise!
Visualization is not important. And, The dish is so unprofessional.
So good.
Good food and atmosphere, but a bit pricier than comparable places I've been to.
The food was delicious and the staff was was really nice. It was a great time. If you've never done it before your server is willing to help you. All in all great time.
overall good taste and nice guys.
(Translated by Google) It’s not as juicy as it is in Korea. It’s popular.  (Original) 한국에서만큼 육즙이 풍부하지 않아요.인기는 많아요

From the moment I walked in the staff was very friendly and attentive. The food was delicious and very flavorful. I am happy to see something new and different compared to your traditional West Loop restaurants. Chris Kim made me feel very welcome by inviting me for a shot haha I will be back again!!

Food is nasty raw meat was brown and green smelled very nasty. Owners/mangers are racist always arguring with employees so  unprofessional!! Grills are very nasty food tasted like soap!!! Do not come here its just a waist of money !!!!!!
Incredible spot.  A must go.
Loved the ambience; food reasonably priced; smell of chocolate at the entrance was irresistable
Nice Korean restaurant Best in the down town Chicago

San Soon Gap San is one of my go-tos in Koreatown. But, to me, its sister eatery in River East is an over-Westernized version of a Korean bbq restaurant, and a bit too trendy and loud. (Conversation is challenging when the place is full.) The prices are on the high end, particularly compared to Koreatown restaurants, which are considerably more reasonably priced. (Our bill came out to more than $300 for five people.) I would’ve liked to have seen more banchan — a measure of a kitchen’s skill and a hallmark of Korean-style generosity/hospitality when it comes to food. But San Soo Korean BBQ would be a good introduction to Korean food for the curious-minded, especially because the staff speaks English.
Every serving hits the spot, damn good food. Come hungry...
A friend suggested this place and I went and had a great meal I will be visiting again.
Spectacular Korean BBQ! Staff is friendly and knowledgeable, food is beyond amaxing - you'll love this place!
It’s great place . Food was fresh and delicious . Thank you to the workers for being so friendly and cool . Defanatly coming back👌
The staff was nice and attentive. The new way of cooking so it doesn't make your clothes smell of smoke works well. Food was delicious.

Went with a large group and had an amazing time. Food was unreal! We shared all of our dishes so I was able to try plenty of options and everyone was amazing. The service was great, very prompt. I will back for birthdays, anniversaries, and pretty much anytime I'm in the city 😁
Great marinades, fat pork belly, and great service!! This location also has a lot of natural sun light and parking in the back! Great place for family and friends!
$30 for 3 slice of beef with bone in. $25 for 3 slice of pork belly

We very much enjoyed our experience here, given the fact that it was our first time indulging in Korean Barbecue. For ~$70 (before tip) we ordered 4 beers, kimchi fried rice, and beef brisket (with bottomless complimentary add-on’s). Each dish is adequately serves two portions, so this is definitely intended for groups of 2 or more. The FOH staff were very helpful and personable, being that it was our first time experiencing Korean BBQ they helped guide us through the preparation of the meat. The kimchi fried rice phenomenal complimented the beef brisket; no dish here lacks flavor.
Very good food and great service!

San Soo looks great. The bar has been moved to the back room. The main room is industrial chic. Rows of hot plate tables to cook you'r own Korean BBQ. Lots of servers roam the room. Your greeted immediately you go through the front door. I went straight from the office without a reservation. A really bad move if you want to eat at a table with a hot plate. Which looked a lot of fun. But a 40 minute wait. However there is another option. All the high top tables and 2 seat tables do not have hot plates. So you can't cook your own. But to my mind that's not a bad thing. We were seated immediately. Had the dumplings. Half pork, half veg. Korean pork and a beef hot bowl. They were great. Flavorful. Service was slick and efficient. Cocktails, wine, bottled and draught beers. Some nice offerings. Be aware there is no parking. A whole new eating experience. San Soo is a great addition to River North. I highly recommend giving it a try.
Gyu KaWHO? This place is the best. Great date spot. Great spot for friends. Great spot to bring your mom or your friends mom. 10/10. Check it out.
Good stuff!
Great food! Our server Chris was SUCH a hunk ;)
Amazing service and food. We had a big group for a birthday and it ended being the perfect place.

Outstanding food and service in a comfortable, modern dining room.  Loved the Kalbi and the hot stone rice bowls.  Lots of vegetarian options which was great for my group.  It was all the fun of a hot pot restaurant, but grilled meat>boiled meat. This was my first K Bbq and I’ll be back.
This place is just awesome. Great food and service. Can’t wait to go again!
